indications:
Indications treatment of moderate to severe manic
episodes associated with bipolar disorder
name: ASENAPINE
breadcrumbs: 4.2 Drugs used in psychoses and related disorders
cautions:
Cautions see section 4.2.1; also
dementia with Lewy Bodies
side-effects:
Side-effects see section 4.2.1; also
taste disturbance, tongue swelling, glossodynia, anxiety, speech disturbance,
dysphagia, transient oral hypoaesthesia and paraesthesia, rhabdomyolysis
doses:
Monotherapy, adult over
18 years initially 10 mg twice daily, reduced to 5 mg twice daily
according to response

Combination therapy, adult over
18 years initially 5 mg twice daily, increased if necessary to 10 mg
twice daily according to response
pregnancy:
Pregnancy use only if potential benefit outweighs risk—toxicity
in animal studies
